content:
Try this:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General 

- scroll all the way down and click the 'Config editor' button on the right 
- click 'Accept the risk and continue' if that appears 
- search for accessibility.force_disabled > change the value to 1 > click the check mark 
- restart TB

content: You appear to have set up the account as IMAP. With IMAP, the account syncs to the server. What you see on the PC is a copy of what is on the server. When you delete from the PC, the account syncs to the server and deletes it there as well. This is not a thunderbird bug or unique process; it's how IMAP works. To do what you want, first COPY (not move) the message to local folders. Then, delete it.
creator: davidsk

content: So, canI change the account to POP? If so, how? And would that solve my problem?
creator: Philthy

content: It depends. If you also want full access via smartphone or an additional PC, then IMAP is the way to go. If you want POP, just set up a second account alongside the IMAP account and then delete the IMAP account when done.

content: Waarom zou u de e-mailberichten doorsturen naar Thunderbird als je je Gmail-account gewoon aan Thunderbird kunt toevoegen. Het automatisch doorsturen is overigens een typische server-side actie die niet in Thunderbird zit, omdat dat een client is. Het is wel mogelijk, maar dan zou het apparaat met Thunderbird constant aan moeten staan.

content:
wolfman141 said
My problem has escalated.

Your account did not work and you deleted it and now you are saying it has escalated. It has not, it remains unchanged from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1540762

I will close this duplicate topic and suggest you continue the discussion in your earlier topic. Perhaps restart that conversation with some useful information. See Below.

Before, I wasn't able to fix the constant request for password on that account. Now, after deleting the account on my laptop, I can't even add it back.
and a not working account and this is different exactly how. It is the same thing your account did not work and you appear to think trying to add it again with exactly the same settings is somehow going to fix it. Nothing is less likely so now you have no account to fix. Wonderful.
Error message says "incoming server already exists."
\

That will be the outgoing server (SMTP) for the account you removed. That has to be removed separately.

I do have another email account with the same domain, but this is not a problem on my desktop computer, only on my laptop. (It used to work find on my laptop, too, but it stopped receiving emails on 8/20/)

When it stopped is somewhat irrelevant except to check things like the windows update log for changes on that date.


Below Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.com/, create an account if you do not already have one and paste the clipboard there, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created to a rely here.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX

content: Not started when? You hit enter perhaps, although in HTML terms of HTML that is a new paragraph, not a new line as HTML automatically wraps into the space it is provided (this can be quite a long line if you are using a wide aspect 120" television as your monitor.) But the same can be said of word processors, they insert a new paragraph when you hit the enter key and wrap paragraph text to fit the paper the printer is designated as having.
